Unseen Predator.name: Unseen Predator
Unseen Predator.blurb: While in brush, Rengar leaps at his target with his basic attack. Rengar's abilities build Ferocity. Upon reaching full Ferocity, his next ability becomes empowered and grants him Movement Speed on cast, but he instantly loses all Ferocity if he leaves combat. Killing enemy champions awards trophies on Rengar's Bonetooth Necklace, permanently increasing his Attack Damage.
Unseen Predator.description: Innate: While in  brush, Rengar's basic attacks have  725 range and cause him to  leap to enemies beyond his normal  melee range. This effect lingers for 0.25 seconds upon exiting brush. Leaping with 0 Ferocity generates 1 Ferocity.
Unseen Predator.description2: Ferocity: Rengar generates 1 Ferocity whenever he casts a basic ability. Reaching 4 Ferocity makes his next ability empowered, granting an additional cast along with 30 / 40 / 50% (based on level)  bonus movement speed for 1.5 seconds at the cost of all Ferocity. Reaching 4 Ferocity with  Savagery or  Bola Strike  locks its empowered version for 0.1 seconds before and after casting it. All Ferocity is lost after being out-of-combat for 8 seconds.
Unseen Predator.description3: Bonetooth Necklace:  Takedowns within 1.5 seconds of being damaged by Rengar grant him a Trophy per unique enemy champion (max 5). An  additional one is made available through the event The Hunt is On!. Trophies grant 1% − 36% (based on  trophies) bonus AD as bonus attack damage.
Unseen Predator.notes:
* Unseen Predator occurs regardless of whether or not Rengar's target has  sight of him.
 Rengar will not leap to targets already in his basic attack range.
 He also cannot leap if he's  rooted.

 The enhanced attack will apply other on-hit effects and can  critically strike as normal.
 Rengar will only leap to a target if his basic attack timer has been refreshed (if not so he will not automatically attempt to path towards his target, despite them being within leap range).
 Rengar can freely use any ability mid-leap.
 Unseen Predator will be lost immediately if Rengar  blinks outside of the brush.
  Rapid Firecannon's and  Savagery's bonus range are lost after 0.25 second(s) upon gaining Unseen Predator, and are re-gained after 0.25 second(s) upon losing Unseen Predator.
 Bonetooth Necklace uses different icons corresponding to the number of stacks acquired: 
 1 Stack:  
 2 Stacks: 
 3 Stacks: 
 4 Stacks: 
 5 Stacks: 
 6th Stack:  Head of Kha'Zix

Savagery.name: Savagery
Savagery.description: Active: Rengar's next two basic attacks within 3 seconds gain  40% bonus attack speed, with the first also gaining  25 bonus range and dealing  bonus physical damage.
Savagery.description2: Empowered Active: Savagery's bonus physical damage is modified and grants Rengar 50% − 101% (based on level)  bonus attack speed for 5 seconds.
Savagery.description3: Savagery resets Rengar's basic attack timer.
Savagery.notes:
* Savagery and Empowered Savagery have no cast time and do not interrupt Rengar's previous orders.
 The enhanced attack applies other  on-hit effects as well as  life steal and can  critically strike as normal (the bonus damage cannot) but does not affect structures.

Battle Roar.name: Battle Roar
Battle Roar.blurb: Rengar lets out a battle roar, damaging enemies and healing for some of the recent damage he has taken. Ferocity effect: additionally breaks crowd control effects.
Battle Roar.description: Passive: Rengar stores 50% of the damage he's taken in the last 1.5 seconds as Grey Health (75% versus monsters).
Battle Roar.description2: Active: Rengar lets out a battle roar, dealing  magic damage to nearby enemies and  healing Rengar for his Grey Health.
Battle Roar.description3: Empowered Active: Battle Roar's magic damage is modified and additionally  cleanses Rengar of all  crowd control.
Battle Roar.notes: * Battle Roar has no cast time and does not interrupt Rengar's previous orders.

Bola Strike.name: Bola Strike
Bola Strike.blurb: Rengar throws a bola, slowing the first target hit for a short duration. Ferocity effect: roots the target.
Bola Strike.description: Active: Rengar throws a bola in the target direction, dealing physical damage to the first enemy hit and  slowing them for 1.75 seconds.
Bola Strike.description2: Empowered Active: Bola Strike's physical damage is modified and  roots its target for 1.75 seconds.
Bola Strike.notes: * If Rengar casts  Savagery and/or  Battle Roar during Bola Strike's cast time, he will buffer them and cast them until Bola Strike completes.

Thrill of the Hunt.name: Thrill of the Hunt
Thrill of the Hunt.blurb: Rengar's predatory instincts take over, Camouflaging him and revealing the nearest enemy champion in a large radius around him. During Thrill of the Hunt, Rengar gains Movement Speed and he can leap to the tracked enemy for a guaranteed critical strike, even without being in brush.
Thrill of the Hunt.description: Active: Rengar  channels his predatory instincts,  revealing the nearest enemy champion and gaining  bonus movement speed for a duration.
Thrill of the Hunt.description2: After 2 seconds he also becomes  camouflaged and gains  Unseen Predator for the remaining duration. His next basic attack within normal attack range against any unit or with Unseen Predator against the nearest enemy champion deals  50% AD  bonus physical damage and reduces the target's  armor for 4 seconds.
Thrill of the Hunt.description3: The nearest enemy champion to Rengar alerts all of their allies within 1200 range about his presence. Attacking or casting any spell (excluding  Savagery) ends Thrill of the Hunt immediately.
Thrill of the Hunt.notes:
* Alerted allies will hear a   threatening growl following an eerie sound effect.
 The enemy have a vision range of Rengar of 1600 units.
 Enemies revealed by Thrill of the Hunt stay revealed for the spell's duration.
 The true vision lingers on his target until the leap completes.
 Thrill of the Hunt does not grant  sight of the target while under the effects of  Paranoia.

 	  	 		 			 		 		 		 			The nearest detected target is automatically pronounced as the victim. This indicator is visible to both teams and may switch targets under certain circumstances.
